Posts.Content: AmyluvsAnt wrote: Had US guided biopsy Monday. Have appt scheduled for next Monday for results. Nerves frayed. Trying to keep busy to pass the time. Doesn't seem to be helping. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Waiting Sucks AmyluvsAnt MTwoman

Posts.Content: Jun 8, 2017 04:34PM AmyluvsAnt wrote: I wish you the best. I too am waiting for proof before telling everyone what's going on. I have 4 grands all under the age of 5. My 2 grown daughters know there is a high possibility i have BC and are both being very supportive and encouraging to me. With the physician offices giving you access to your labs and reports online, my surgeon was surprised i had not already read my reports online when i went in to see her. She too was very honest with me as to what it looked Like to her and the doctors reading my mammo and US. I'm usually very optimistic and encourage my patients to be, but somehow preparing for the worst and then getting good news is strangely more appealing to me than the alternative. I agree with the post of hang on to that doctor. But let your children know that you are going through this. Even though you don't know for sure, they will either releived this turns out be nothing or support for you if it does.
Posts.Title: Concerned 5 months after US did we miss something? PLZ advise Faithoftheheart Hopeful82014

Posts.Content: Jun 9, 2017 12:11PM AmyluvsAnt wrote: The only reason i suggested telling them us because in my case my oldest daughter and 2 of my grands live with my husband and I and my youngest daughter and her husband and children were coming for a visit from out of state 3 days after i had the meeting with my surgeon's office. Both of my daughters know me very well and i was a basket case emotionally and knew i couldn't hide it from them. Prayers for you. Prayers for your daughter in law and that the mag sulfate stops the contractions. My girls are both very strong women and their support has been very helpful. I lost mom back in October and as much i love husband and father, men don't understand what feeling right now. So having my daughters has really helped emotionally.
Posts.Title: Concerned 5 months after US did we miss something? PLZ advise Faithoftheheart Hopeful82014

Posts.Content: AmyluvsAnt wrote: i found a lump about a year ago but because of it being painful and the fact it moved and an incredibly wild and unbelievably rough year, it was not addressed until a few weeks ago. My diagnostic mammogram and US came back Bi-Rads category 5. I have an US guided biopsy scheduled for Monday. The mammogram and US measured the mass as 2.1 x 1.3 x 1.6 but the surgeon i saw stated she Feels a mass that is twice that size. I have been a nurse for over 20 years but CA is definitely not my field. The surgeon gave me the whole looks like a duck and quacks like a duck it must be a duck. Basically she believes a malignancy and all the biopsy is for to determine hormone markers etc. Any chance this something other than CA??? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Worried in Louisiana AmyluvsAnt AmyluvsAnt

Posts.Content: Jun 9, 2017 04:18AM AmyluvsAnt wrote: Yes those are the numbers I'm reading. Not very good odds that it's anything else. My mammogram from about 5 years ago required further images in the same area but i was told it was nothing to worry about. Obviously they were wrong. Nurses are the worst when it comes to their own health. Kicking myself now for not addressing this as soon as i found it, but it changed frequently and all of the things i learned in nursing pointed to not being cancer. Any lump you find needs to be checked out. Mammograms need to be done annually. Like i said nurses need to take better care of themselves and their preventive care must be done.
Posts.Title: Worried in Louisiana AmyluvsAnt AmyluvsAnt

Posts.Content: Jun 9, 2017 04:29AM AmyluvsAnt wrote: i actually feel like the lump has changed location and the way it feels since having the mammogram from hell. It felt like the lump ruptured while It was being compressed in the machine and was very sore for several days afterwards. That to me was some of the worse pain i have experienced in my life. After reading some posts today and the pain associated with and following the biopsy, I'm not too excited to do it either.
Posts.Title: Worried in Louisiana AmyluvsAnt AmyluvsAnt

Posts.Content: Jun 9, 2017 04:41AM AmyluvsAnt wrote: Glad to hear it may not be as painful as others have posted.
Posts.Title: Worried in Louisiana AmyluvsAnt AmyluvsAnt

Posts.Content: Jun 10, 2017 02:15AM AmyluvsAnt wrote: My nerves have been on edge for the past 2 days. I had to wait 2 weeks to have the biopsy because it takes 2 weeks to get procedure approved by my insurance company. I had no idea how hard it was going to be to have to wait until now. They have called me 3 times today from the breast center to ask the same questions. Each time they tell me something different the caller before them didn't tell me. Want to just go to bed and wake up and it be Monday already. Then there is the whole wait another week for results from the doctor. Really hate the wait . My mother passed away in October so not having her here with me makes this even harder. Funny how a grown woman wants Mommy when scared.

Posts.Content: Jun 9, 2017 05:11AM AmyluvsAnt wrote: That's the feeling i had. It really doesn't like to be messed with. It never felt this way before the mammogram. It's been over 2 weeks and still very tender to touch. Thanks for the encouragement. Nobody knows what to say to me right now. Telling me not to worry, those guidelines are not definitive.....etc. I feel all will be okay, but still a little scared. Somehow if i expect the worse and results are better than expected, it's a win.
